title: Version Control with Git in FTC

sections.title: What is Version Control and Why Use It?
sections.content: Version control is a system that tracks changes to your code over time. It lets you experiment safely, collaborate with teammates, and recover from mistakes. Git is the most popular version control system for software projects, including FTC robotics.

sections.title: Setting Up Git in Android Studio
sections.content:
1. Install Git from git-scm.com.
  2. Open your FTC project in Android Studio.
  3. Go to VCS > Enable Version Control Integration and select Git.
  4. Use the Git panel at the bottom to manage your repository.

sections.title: Basic Git Workflow (commit, push, pull)
sections.content:
• Commit: Save a snapshot of your changes locally.
  • Push: Upload your commits to a remote repository (e.g., GitHub).
  • Pull: Download new commits from the remote repository.

sections.title: Using GitHub for Collaboration
sections.content:
1. Create a free account at github.com.
  2. Create a new repository for your team.
  3. Push your local code to GitHub using Android Studio or the command line.
  4. Invite teammates to collaborate and review code.

sections.title: Example: .gitignore for FTC Projects
sections.content:
# Ignore build files and local settings
/build/
/.idea/
*.iml
local.properties
.DS_Store
*.apk
*.keystore

sections.title: Best Practices for Version Control
sections.content:
• Commit early and often with clear messages.
  • Never commit build files or secrets.
  • Use branches for new features or experiments.
  • Pull before you push to avoid conflicts.
  • Review teammates' code before merging.

sections.title: Troubleshooting Common Git Issues
sections.content:
• Merge conflicts? Carefully review and resolve differences in the affected files.
  • Can't push? Make sure you have permission and your branch is up to date.
  • Accidentally deleted code? Use Git history to restore previous versions.
